intro: Cnestis hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy cnestis, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and small, clustered white or yellow flowers. It typically grows as an annual or perennial herb, often found in disturbed soils and open habitats. Cnestis hirsuta is noted for its adaptability to various environmental conditions and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
